data.title: Fields of Mourning
data.meta_description: The Fields of Mourning is the third Location you will have to battle your way through in the Underworld in Hades 2. It's a vast, empty space
data.text:
Enemy Attack Style

Blight-Shade

These small, yellow balls of Shade launch red projectiles at you that cause damage on impact. They are the weakest of the enemies in the Fields of Mourning.

Blood-Shade

These Shades are far more dangerous than their Blight counterparts and chase you around the arena like a needle. They are very fast and best taken on from a distance.

Bloat-Shade

Bloat-Shades suck you up and explode when you reach them. They are best tackled with long-range shots so you remain clear of their stream.

Bawlder

Bawlders are very fast and often armored. They roll towards you and cause damage on impact, so you're best bet is to hit them from a distance with a special or other long-range attack.

Smacker

Smackers aren't too difficult to deal with unless you become overwhelmed by them. You should be safe to attack them as normal.

Holeheart

Holehearts summon red bombs from their chests which they throw onto the battlefield. These hurt you on impact and also create a land-mine effect where they will explode if you step on the red circle they create on the ground. Steer clear of these when tackling Holehearts.

Mourner

Mourners are incredibly fast and charge at you while punching you with their four arms. Wait until they finish charging to attack.

Canine

These are small minions summoned by Lycaons. They are bothersome, but you are better off focusing on getting rid of the Lycaon that created them than getting caught up clearing the Canines.

Lycaon

Lycaons are powerful and fast. Their main attacks are a charged leap that covers a great distance and summoning Canines. These enemies are best dealt with from a distance.

Lamia

Lamia's are serpent-like beings that call down red beams of energy that follow you around the battlefield. The beams move slowly, making them relatively easy to dodge while attacking the Lamia that created them.

Wailer

Wailers take a deep, audible breath before letting out an almighty screech and following you around the arena. You can hit them with a projectile while they are screaming to make them stop if they don't have armor, otherwise, running is your best option.

Sorrow-Spiller

The Mourning Fields also spawn smaller and less powerful versions of the Shadow-Spiller mini-boss of Erebus. They can be bothersome in battle since you can't see any of the other enemies through their shadow. Focus on dispatching these before the other enemies in the area.
